data.message:
I don't understand what are you trying to achieve.
You're dynamically generating a mesh (setting vertices, normal, etc.) and want to apply a tiled texture to it?
From what I see in the third image, I think your problem might be in generating the UV coordinates for the vertices, when the height of the wall increases you don't change the UV accordingly (you keep using the same value as if the wall is short) so the texture gets skewed!

Yup i kept searching for 6 hours :(
the problem is in my UVs values i'm trying to generate better values but nothing so far is ideal it's better but not the best yet
Try to make the U a multiple of X+Z and the V a multiple of Y

Well i have been working on this for about 10 hours and i almost solved all the issues just need a little more time on X UVs 
it was about UV and vertex relation 
i created a 24 UVs points for each face in the house 
i got better results. much better actually
